title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to their highest level in three years, topping around $2,800 per tonne, driven by rising demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades. Supply constraints include China's power shortages limiting smelting output, new environmental regulations, and unrest in Guinea affecting bauxite supply. The metal is increasingly vital for the green transition due to its recyclability and role in decarbonization.

title: Aluminum Rises to 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures rose to $2,799.20 per tonne on October 16, 2025, up 1.90% from the previous day and marking a 3-year high amid tight supply and bullish demand expectations. Chinese authorities lowered their annual output growth target for base metals, contributing to supply concerns. Prices have increased 4.29% over the past month and 9.30% year-over-year.

title: LME Week: US Aluminum Price Rise Spurs Deliveries from Canada
summary: The rise in US aluminum prices, around $2,750 per ton plus Midwest premiums, has encouraged increased deliveries from Canada, though not yet at full pace. The Midwest premium hit a record high of $0.77 per lb. on October 6, reflecting tariff impacts and supply tightness. Canadian exports to the US have fallen year-on-year, while deliveries to Europe have increased significantly.

title: US Aluminium Price Rise Spurs Deliveries from Canada
summary: Physical market aluminum consumers pay the London Metal Exchange price plus a Midwest premium, which has surged due to tariffs and supply constraints. Canadian aluminum deliveries to the US have decreased, but shipments to Europe have risen. The premium reflects ongoing trade and tariff tensions affecting the North American aluminum market.

title: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Inventories in Key Cities Drop on Oct 17
summary: Secondary aluminum enterprises maintained flat quotations amid a wait-and-see market stance. The SMM ADC12 price held steady at 21,050 yuan/mt, while inventories of secondary aluminum ingots in key Chinese cities declined, indicating tightening supply conditions in the secondary aluminum market.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to their highest level in three years, reaching around $2,800 per tonne due to rising supply concerns and growing demand from clean energy sectors such as electric vehicles and renewable power. Production is affected by China's power shortages, stricter environmental rules on coal-powered plants, and unrest in Guinea, a major bauxite supplier.

title: Japan Q4 aluminium talks drag out in effort to bridge gap, say sources
summary: Quarterly pricing talks between Japanese aluminium buyers and global producers have extended unusually long due to a wide gap in price expectations amid sluggish demand and high inventories. Japanese aluminium stocks rose slightly, while producers hold out for higher premiums influenced by rising prices in the US and Europe.

title: Consultation opens for $2 billion green aluminium production credit
summary: The Australian government has opened consultation on a $2 billion Green Aluminium Production Credit aimed at decarbonizing aluminium smelters by promoting production using renewable energy. The initiative supports Australia's ambition to lead in low-carbon aluminium production, which is critical for the energy transition and reducing greenhouse gas emissions from this energy-intensive industry.

title: US aluminum industry seeks export curbs on some scrap material
summary: The US Aluminum Association has called for restrictions on exports of certain aluminum scrap materials to strengthen domestic supply. The proposal includes an immediate ban on exports of used beverage containers outside North America and improved tracking to enforce restrictions, aiming to support US manufacturers amid high import tariffs and global competition.

title: Aluminum Extrusion Market CAGR to be at 5.2% from 2025 to 2029
summary: The aluminum extrusion market is projected to grow robustly to $115.59 billion by 2029, driven by government support, urbanization, and increased demand in automotive and packaging sectors. Growth is also fueled by trends in green building construction, where aluminum's sustainability and recyclability are highly valued.

title: Aluminum Market to Reach USD $243.04 Billion by 2029 at 6.4% CAGR
summary: The global aluminum market is expected to grow to $243.04 billion by 2029, with a CAGR of 6.4%, driven by advances in recycling, electric vehicle demand, construction, and aerospace sectors. Innovations such as 3D printing and new aluminum alloys, along with increased use in packaging and renewable energy projects, are key growth factors.

title: Weekly Recap: Aluminium's low-carbon revolution in action
summary: RUSAL has introduced an innovative electrochemical technology to convert off-grade aluminium scrap into high-purity metal, supporting sustainability and circular practices. Taural India and Egypt Aluminium are implementing low-carbon and renewable energy projects to reduce emissions by up to 80% and 30%, respectively, enhancing competitiveness and eco-friendly production in various sectors.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have surged to a three-year high driven by demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades, with new low-carbon aluminum smelting projects underway globally. Automakers and tech companies are securing long-term contracts for low-carbon aluminum, while policies like the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism push producers toward decarbonization and improved recycling infrastructure.

title: How green aluminium is transforming the metal industry
summary: Green aluminium production focuses on reducing carbon emissions through low-carbon smelting and increased recycling, with only 25% of global production currently classified as green. Despite challenges like high transition costs, growing consumer and industrial demand for sustainable aluminium is driving market growth and innovation, with countries like Brazil planning further emission cuts.

title: Aluminium's real paradox â€“ energy use vs carbon saving
summary: Recycling aluminium scrap is the most effective sustainability approach, saving up to 95% energy compared to primary production and reducing CO2 emissions by nine tonnes per tonne recycled. Increasing renewable energy use and advanced technologies like AI-driven cell efficiency improvements are critical to further emission reductions, with the industry having achieved 25% of its 2030 carbon reduction target so far.

title: 7 Critical Threats Facing the Global Aluminum Industry
summary: The aluminum industry faces significant challenges from tightening environmental regulations, rising production costs, and supply chain disruptions. The energy-intensive Hall-HÃ©roult process contributes heavily to emissions, prompting regulatory scrutiny such as the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism. Companies are responding with strategic investments in emissions monitoring, policy engagement, and industry coalitions to balance compliance and competitiveness.

title: Jinshi Futures Morning Update - October 17, 2025
summary: The update discusses various market trends, including ferrosilicon prices from Hebei Steel, which were set at RMB 5,660/ton for October, down RMB 140/ton. However, it does not specifically focus on steel prices. Precious metals have seen significant volatility, with gold and silver hitting record highs.

title: Tata Steel Share Price Live Updates
summary: Tata Steel's share price closed at Rs 173.24 in the previous trading session and is experiencing a slight gain today. The update focuses on stock market dynamics rather than steel prices specifically.

title: JSW Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price
summary: JSW Steel Ltd's stock price increased by 0.29%, reaching â‚¹1,173.10 per share. This update is about stock performance rather than steel market trends.

title: Taiwan's Tung Ho Steel Keeps H-Beam Prices Flat
summary: Tung Ho Steel has maintained stable H-beam prices for the second half of October, continuing a trend of price stability throughout most of 2025. This decision reflects a consistent approach to pricing in the Taiwanese market.

title: HRC Steel Price Update
summary: HRC Steel prices rose to $815/ton on October 16, 2025, marking a slight increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen by 0.25%, and are up 15.60% year-over-year.

title: India's Steel Giants Risk Locking in 12 Billion Tonnes of COâ‚‚
summary: India's major steel companies are planning significant capacity expansions, which could hinder the country's climate goals and expose them to EU carbon tariffs. The expansion relies heavily on traditional blast furnace technology due to the high cost of low-carbon alternatives. This poses a risk to achieving India's net-zero targets by 2070.

title: Tata Steel awarded worldsteel Safety and Health Excellence Recognition 2025
summary: Tata Steel has received the World Steel Association's Safety and Health Excellence Recognition for its process safety management. This is the company's third consecutive recognition, highlighting its commitment to safety and innovation in preventing high-risk operational scenarios.

title: Jindal Stainless Doubles Slag Capacity to Boost Circular Production
summary: Jindal Stainless, India's largest stainless steel producer, has doubled its slag processing capacity to enhance circular production. This move aims to improve sustainability and efficiency in its operations.

title: Single-step Steelmaking Technology for Cheaper and Sustainable Steel
summary: Hertha Metals in Conroe, Texas, has developed a single-step steelmaking technology that converts low-grade iron ore directly into molten steel or high-purity iron, bypassing traditional multi-step, coal-heavy processes. This innovation promises cheaper, more energy-efficient steel production and aims to reduce reliance on imports and scrap recycling, addressing supply chain risks and rising demand.

title: SHS Group Secures $1.8B Financing for Power4Steel, Advancing Germanyâ€™s Green Steel Transition
summary: Germanyâ€™s SHSâ€“Stahl-Holding-Saar Group secured â‚¬1.7 billion financing for its Power4Steel project, one of Europeâ€™s largest steel decarbonization initiatives. The project aims to cut COâ‚‚ emissions by 55% by 2030 and achieve climate neutrality by 2045 through hydrogen-based production and electric arc furnace technology, supported by federal and regional governments.

title: Green steel projects in Europe are being postponed in 2025 due to ongoing uncertainties
summary: Several green steel projects across Europe, including Germanyâ€™s Salcos Green Steel Project and the Czech Republicâ€™s largest decarbonization investment, have been postponed due to economic, technical, and regulatory uncertainties. High energy costs, unclear market protection regulations, and insufficient policy support are causing delays, impacting Europeâ€™s carbon neutrality goals in steel production.

title: Copper Miners Plunge Amid US-China Tensions
summary: Shares in Australian copper mining companies fell significantly due to a drop in copper prices driven by escalating US-China tensions. Concerns about reduced demand from China, a major copper consumer, have pressured prices and impacted copper producers' market valuations.

title: Copper Market Trends: Volatility and Supply Pressures Shape 2025
summary: Copper prices are forecasted to remain elevated through 2026 due to structural supply-demand imbalances and rising demand from the energy transition. Price scenarios range from $9,000 to $15,000 per tonne depending on supply disruptions and demand growth, with risks including economic slowdowns and trade tensions.

title: Copper price rebounds as traders see $12,000 within reach after rally
summary: Copper prices have rebounded recently, with traders optimistic about reaching $12,000 per tonne following a strong rally. This reflects bullish sentiment amid ongoing supply constraints and demand from energy transition sectors.

title: Japan, the West, and South Korea Report Continued Decline in TC/RC; LME Copper Slightly Lower Overnight
summary: Copper futures on the LME showed slight gains after fluctuating overnight, closing at $10,620/mt. Japan, Spain, and South Korea warned that the sharp decline in copper concentrate treatment and refining charges threatens the mining and smelting industry chain, potentially forcing some smelters to scale back or exit.

title: Comex Copper Settles 0.28% Lower at $4.9580 â€” Data Talk
summary: Comex copper prices declined by 0.28% to $4.9580 per pound, marking a third consecutive session of losses and the largest three-day decline since October 10, 2025. Despite recent drops, copper remains up over 24% from its 52-week low earlier this year.

title: Copper slips as US govt shutdown, trade tensions weigh - Markets
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange fell 0.7% to $10,566 per metric ton amid concerns over a US government shutdown and ongoing trade tensions. These factors contribute to market uncertainty despite tight supply conditions.

title: SMM Exclusive: Overview of Metal Production in September 2025 and Forecast for October
summary: China's copper cathode production in September 2025 decreased by 4.31% month-on-month due to increased smelter maintenance and tight copper anode supply, despite a year-on-year increase of 11.62%. Production is expected to decline further in October and November as maintenance continues and supply constraints persist, with operating rates dropping especially for large smelters.

title: Copper reaches 16-month high due to supply concerns and lower dollar
summary: Copper prices hit a 16-month high at $10,479 per metric ton driven by supply disruptions including the suspension of Freeport McMoRanâ€™s Grasberg operations after a mudslide, and other disruptions in Congo and Chile. The weakening U.S. dollar also contributed by making copper cheaper for holders of other currencies, despite weak demand forecasts from China.

title: Copper Price Update: Q2 2025 in Review
summary: Copper prices were volatile in Q2 2025 but remained elevated overall, influenced by tariffs, global economic uncertainty, and trade tensions. The market may have entered a supply deficit due to disruptions such as the shutdown at Ivanhoe-Zijin Kakula-Kamoa mine in the DRC, with production guidance lowered significantly, highlighting tight copper supply against growing demand from structural growth sectors like AI data centers and energy transition.

title: Daily Nickel price, Lme Comex Shfe Price of Nickel live | SMM
summary: The latest SMM spot price for #1 Nickel is USD 15,000.3â€“15,335.02 per metric ton, with an average of USD 15,167.66, up 25.85 from the previous day. Nickel briquettes and JinChuan Nickel also saw slight increases, while Indonesian refined nickel prices dropped by USD 260 per tonne.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Maintain Fluctuating Trend on October 17
summary: SMM #1 refined nickel prices in China ranged from 121,000 to 123,700 yuan per metric ton, averaging 122,350 yuan, up 200 yuan from the previous day. The market continues to experience fluctuations amid ongoing global economic and political developments.

title: Nickel Glut Persists but African Mining Ambitions Remain Strong
summary: The International Nickel Study Group forecasts a global nickel surplus of 209,000 tons in 2025 and 261,000 tons in 2026, despite production cuts in Indonesia. Nickel prices have fallen about 50% since 2022, but African mining projects continue to advance, with First Quantum Minerals ramping up output in Zambia.

title: Nickel Glut Persists but African Mining Ambitions Remain Strong
summary: The International Nickel Study Group (INSG) projects a global nickel surplus of 209,000 tons in 2025 and 261,000 tons in 2026 despite production cuts in Indonesia. African mining projects by First Quantum Minerals, Ivanhoe Mines, and Lifezone Metals continue to advance, with First Quantum ramping up production at its Enterprise mine in Zambia, expecting 25,000 tons in 2025. Nickel prices have fallen about 50% since 2022 due to oversupply in the battery sector.

title: LME WEEK: Nickel market could stay in oversupply until 2030
summary: According to Macquarie, the global nickel market is expected to remain in surplus until 2030, indicating prolonged oversupply conditions. This outlook aligns with recent projections of continued excess production relative to demand in the nickel sector.

title: Canada Nickel touts $70B GDP boost from Timmins mine project
summary: Canada Nickel highlights that its proposed Crawford open-pit nickel mine near Timmins is expected to generate over $70 billion in GDP benefits. This project represents a significant investment in nickel production capacity in Canada, contributing to economic growth and mining sector expansion.

title: Nickel Asia faces P7 million penalty as Mindoro geothermal deal ends
summary: Nickel Asia Corporation is facing a penalty of 7 million Philippine pesos following the conclusion of its geothermal deal in Mindoro. The company disclosed this development to the Philippine Stock Exchange, reflecting operational and contractual changes impacting its business.

title: PT Vale and PAMA Officially Launch Nickel Mining Project in Kolaka
summary: PT Vale and PAMA have officially launched a new nickel mining project in Kolaka, Indonesia. This development marks an expansion of nickel production capacity in the region, supporting Indonesia's position as a major nickel producer.

title: Vale scraps plans to build Quebec nickel sulphate facility
summary: Vale has canceled its plans to build a nickel sulphate facility in Quebec following a pause in the second phase of a cathode factory by GM and a partner. This decision impacts the expansion of nickel processing capacity in North America.

title: PT Vale urges nickel producers pivot toward "the right nickel" during LME Week 2025
summary: PT Vale Indonesia emphasized the importance of producing nickel responsibly, focusing on low-carbon, ethically mined, and transparently sourced nickel to support the green revolution. The company highlighted the need for nickel production that aligns with sustainability goals amid rising demand for clean-energy minerals.

title: Nickel Market Size to Cross USD 84.49 Billion by 2034
summary: The global nickel market is projected to grow significantly, driven by innovations including AI that optimize the nickel value chain from exploration to processing. AI technologies are enhancing sustainability by reducing waste, improving yield, enabling predictive maintenance, and supporting ESG monitoring to lower carbon footprints in nickel projects.

title: Mining companies make stunning discovery that could be crucial for sustainable nickel production
summary: Eagle Mine is piloting D-Solve technology to increase nickel purity by reducing magnesium impurities by 40%, which could extend mine life and improve process efficiencies. This innovation reduces waste and energy use in nickel mining, supporting lower production costs and advancing clean energy transition goals.

title: Movers & Shakers October 2025: Sofi Prima to Enhance Nickel Sulphate Production at Battery Chemicals Plant
summary: Sofi Filtration introduced the Sofi Prima ultra-sound self-cleaning filtration technology to improve nickel sulphate production purity at Terrafame's battery chemicals plant in Finland. This energy-efficient, chemical-free filtration system reduces maintenance and water usage, enhancing sustainability and operational efficiency in nickel processing.

title: Greening nickel extraction requires institutional and financial support
summary: A promising low-carbon nickel extraction technology has been highlighted, but scaling it to reduce the industry's carbon footprint requires overcoming institutional and financial barriers. The article stresses the environmental impact of nickel mining, particularly from clearing carbon-rich forests, and the need for systemic support to advance sustainable extraction.

title: Italy awards Prysmian $539mn contract for Tunisia-Europe power cable
summary: Italy has awarded Prysmian a contract worth $539 million to build a submarine power cable connecting Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The cable will run from the Partanna substation in Sicily to the Mlaabi substation in Tunisia, supporting cleaner energy integration between the two countries.

title: Prysmian wins 460 million euros power cable deal connecting Italy and Tunisia
summary: Prysmian secured a contract valued at approximately 460 million euros to build a submarine power cable between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The project aims to enhance energy connectivity and support the transition to cleaner energy sources in both countries.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel Involving Prysmian and Others
summary: The Italian Antitrust Authority has launched an investigation into alleged anti-competitive practices among major low voltage copper cable manufacturers in Italy, including Prysmian. The probe focuses on coordinated pricing and sales conditions dating back to 2005, with inspections conducted at company offices and distributors.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Prysmian SpA, the world's largest copper cable manufacturer, views the US government's 50% copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire Corp., is engaging with US officials to navigate the tariff's impact on costs and supply.
